member.name: M:UvARescue.Tools.RegularThread.Start
member.summary:
Starts the wrapped thread. The Run member is referenced as the the main executive routine of this thread.
Please note that by default the wrapped thread will run with lower priority than the UI in order to ensure UI responsiveness.

member.name: M:UvARescue.Tools.RegularThread.Stop
member.summary:
Stops the wrapped thread.
The wrapped thread will be politely asked to stop by setting IsRunning to false. After 10 seconds of no reaction the wrapped thread will be forced to abort.

member.name: T:UvARescue.Tools.DataQueue`1
member.summary: A (limited) queue of Graphical Object.
member.remarks: Copy/Edit of MultiStateSensor, without Sensor inheritance.

member.name: M:UvARescue.Tools.PausableThread.Pause
member.summary:
Just sets the IsPaused flag to true. This does not actually pause the wrapped thread yet. Pausing will occur only as soon as CheckForPause is invoked.
It will always be an external (other) thread that invokes Pause and Resume on this thread. However, the actual pausing should NOT happen on these, but on the wrapped thread. That's why pausing will only occur as soon as the wrapped thread calls CheckForPause.
As a consequence, pausing will only have any effect if the Run method actually invokes CheckForPause from time to time.

member.name: M:UvARescue.Tools.PausableThread.CheckForPause
member.summary: This member should be invoked by subclasses as part of their Run routine. If the paused flag was set to true by an external thread (through invoking Pause) then the wrapped thread will enter a (non-busy) waiting state. The wrapped thread continues execution when an external thread calls Resume.

member.name: M:UvARescue.Tools.PausableThread.Resume
member.summary: Will resume the execution of the wrapped thread.

member.name: T:UvARescue.Tools.PausableThread
member.summary: This class wraps a Thread in such a way that the main execution can be paused without (!) busy-waiting to occur. So, pausing this thread actually should yield the benefit of having resources being freed up for other threads.

member.name: T:UvARescue.Tools.Graph`2
member.summary: Strong-typed template data structure for Graphs. You cannot just inherit it by itself, the Graph and the GraphNode and GraphLink classes should be inherited simultaneously for all template specifiers to work.

member.name: M:UvARescue.Tools.TcpConnection.Send(System.String)
member.summary: a string-based (ASCII) message sending format is assumed.
